Introduction to Amarok
Amarok is a powerful audio player for the KDE environment. Features include a context browser, integration with many online music services and support for management of several digital music players including Apple's iPod.

sect2.title: Installation of Amarok

note.para: Amarok depends strongly on $KDE_PREFIX. If a new version of KDE is installed in a different location (for instance installing kde in a versioned directory of /opt), then this package will need to be reinstalled.

sect2.para: Install Amarok by running the following commands:

screen.userinput:
mkdir build && cd build &&
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=&kde-dir; \ -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release \ -DKDE4_BUILD_TESTS=OFF \ -Wno-dev .. && make

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: -DKDE4_BUILD_TESTS=OFF: This switch disables the integrated tests. The test suite requires Google Mock.
